alert.note: Alert for Eastern Chittenden; Eastern Franklin; Lamoille; Washington; Western Chittenden; Western Franklin (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 1:35PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Lamoille, northeastern Chittenden, northwestern Washington and southeastern Franklin Counties through 215 PM EDT... At 134 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorms over Cambridge and Bolton, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Waterville, Underhill, Cambridge, Bakersfield, Cambridge Village, Stowe, Waterbury Village, Johnson, Jeffersonville Village, Waterbury, Underhill State Park, Fairfax, Belvidere Center, Bolton, Fletcher, Fairfield, Belvidere, Jericho, Johnson Village and Westford. This includes Interstate 89 between mile markers 63 and 73. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for central and northwestern Vermont.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Chittenden; Eastern Franklin; Lamoille; Washington; Western Chittenden; Western Franklin
